frameDefinitions: The Cognizers have a similarity (or dissimilarity) in their Opinion.
One linguistic unit, Sign_1, has a relation to another linguistic unit, Sign_2.
Item-1 and Item-2 are compatible with each other if they can exist or function together in some context without problems, conflict, or other undesirable situation.
A Captor ends the captivity or inhibition of the motion of a Theme from the Location_of_confinement.
A concept, Concept_1, is related causally or collocationally to another concept, Concept_2 by means of some evidence.
This frame is about the static comparison of an Profiled_item to a Standard_item, often  with respect to some Attribute.
frameExamples: Dr. Gerry and Mr. Pond <t>agree</t> in their impressions.
Make sure your site is <t>compatible</t> with any browser.
They <t>released</t> me from prison on New Year's Day.
The Sun is putting on a show that <t>rivals</t> the most sizzling Hollywood thrillers.
listRoleDefinitions: This role marks constituents that express the set of <fen>Cognizers</fen> whose similarity of opinion is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Cognizer_1</fen> is the individual characterized by their similarity in opinion to <fen>Cognizer_2</fen>, whose opinion is assumed to be known.  <fen>Cognizer_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Cognizer_2</fen> is the one whose opinion is assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing the opinion of <fen>Cognizer_1</fen>.

This role denotes an implicit question in response to which the <fen>Cognizers</fen> give their <fen>Opinion</fen>s, which are then assessed for their similarity.  The <fen>Question</fen> may concern the identitiy of a particular entity, as in the first example below, or it may be of the yes/no-type, as in the second example below.
A state of affairs believed by the <fen>Cognizers</fen>.
A phenomenon that the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are considering with respect to their <fen>Opinion</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are in agreement or disagreement.
The Place is the general area in which the Cognizers are in agreement or disagreement.
FN: a linguistic unit that carries semantic, phonological or syntactic information.
FN: a linguistic unit
FN: Linguistic units
The Frame Element <fen>Item_1</fen> marks the grammatically more prominent of the two entities, i.e.the subject in active clauses, when they are expressed separately.
The Frame Element <fen>Item_2</fen> marks the grammatically less prominent of the <fen>Items</fen> when they are expressed separately.
This role is used when the <fen>Items</fen> are expressed jointly in a phrase, either a plural or a coordinated NP.
This Frame Element is used for expressions that indicate a <fen>Parameter</fen> or respect in which the <fen>Items</fen> are said to be compatible, not in conflict.
The <fen>Captor</fen> is the individual who ends the confinement or captivity of the <fen>Theme</fen>. The release of the <fen>Theme</fen> is in accord with the plans of the <fen>Captor</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the person or object in motion released by the <fen>Captor</fen>.
The location to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s motion was formerly inhibited.
The <fen>Time</fen> identifies when the <fen>Captor</fen> release the <fen>Theme</fen> .
The location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ceases to be confined.
The concept which is linked to <fen>Concept_2</fen>.  Generally expressed as the external argument.
The concept which is tied to <fen>Concept_1</fen>.  Generally expressed as a PP complement.
The two concepts expressed jointly.
In active sentences, the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> is the grammatically more prominent one of the items that are compared and realized as  the subject. .
In active setnnces, the <fen>Standard_item</fen> is  the grammatically less prominent element, i.e. the object or an oblique.
This Frame Elements marks constituents that indicate in which respect Item-1 and Item-2 are equal to each other.
The <fen>Standard_attribute</fen> is used when the standard is a specific value on  a scale.
The <fen>Profiled_attribute</fen> is a particular value on a scale which is being compared to a <fen>Standard_item</fen> or <fen>Profiled_attribute</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> rivals the <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> rivals the <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
listRoleExamples: I think we see eye to eye <fex>in our ultimate goal</fex>, which is that we want to see a democratic Serbia.
We agree <fex>that babies should not be dropped from helicopters</fex>.
In one sense, <fex>dog</fex> is a hyponym of itself.
In one sense, dog is a hyponym of <fex>itself</fex>.
<fex>Happy and sad</fex> are antonyms.
<fex>That technology</fex> turned out not to be compatible with the existing devices
My computer is not compatible <fex>with my new printer</fex>.
<fex>Your socks</fex> don't match.
The two applications are compatible <fex>in their essential features</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> released the suspect.
The police released <fex>the suspect</fex>.
She petitioned unsuccessfully for their release <fex>from Chateau D'If</fex>.
'Aren't you going to release us <fex>here</fex>?' she asked.
<fex>Smoking</fex> is tied to cancer.
Smoking is tied <fex>to cancer</fex>.
<fex>Smoking and weight gain</fex> are connected.
<fex>This PC</fex> stacks up well against its competitors
This PC stacks up well <fex>against its competitors</fex>
The Tri-Cities stack up well against the competition <fex>in the area of innovation</fex>
We equalled <fex>father's skills</fex> .
American caviar <fex>now</fex> rivals Russia's in quality.
<fex>In Africa</fex>, the level of drug resistance rivals even Noatirtin's vaunted efficacy.
